\t\tHydrogel - lenses with a high moisture content. Recommended for people prone to allergic reactions, since the materials of hydrogel lenses are hypoallergenic;\n\t\tSilicone hydrogel - lenses with high oxygen permeability. In rare cases, they can provoke an allergic reaction.
Recommendations on the mode of wearing

\t\tDoctors recommend using daytime lenses. They are the safest with regular maintenance. Prolonged use of lenses can limit the access of oxygen to the eyes and provoke the development of pathological conditions.\n\t\tIn addition, pathogenic bacteria accumulate on the lenses, and this is fraught with complications for the eyes.

\t\tOphthalmologists advise to give preference to lenses of a more frequent replacement regime - one day or two weeks. They are safer for the eyes, since they do not have time to accumulate on their surface a large number of bacteria or lipid deposits, which can provoke severe conjunctivitis and keratitis.
